title: Vote count under way as Rwanda polls close
description:
(4 Aug 2017) Polls for Rwanda's presidential election came to a close on Friday.
The incumbent president, Paul Kagame, is widely expected to win the vote.
Kagame won the 2010 election with 93 percent of the vote and told a rally in July that "the day of the presidential elections will just be a formality."
He is running against Frank Habineza of the Democratic Green Party of Rwanda - the only permitted opposition party - and independent candidate Philippe Mpayimana.
There were long lines at polling stations in some parts of the capital, Kigali. 
Mpayimana and Habineza voted in other locations in the capital.
At some polling stations, music urged voters to choose the candidate who will transform the country and unite all Rwandans.


You can license this story through AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/metadata/youtube/87d610d6502476dd0e64d714465adf5c 
Find out more about AP Archive: http://www.aparchive.com/HowWeWork
